cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest then north-northwest, skirting the east-central Florida coast and then paralleling the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the east-central Florida coast (around Cape Canaveral)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton, FL to South Santee River, SC (Hurricane Warning area that includes Cape Canaveral)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East coast of Florida from Boca Raton through Cape Canaveral, northward to Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible, with tropical-storm force (≥39 mph) almost certain
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 7–11 ft inundation if peak surge occurs at high tide along the Cape Canaveral area
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals near 15 inches possible along the east-central Florida coast
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, isolated tornadoes in rainbands
